title: [Neuroscience] A new study has found that appendages, called cilia, on neurons in the brain have a key role in ensuring a specific dopamine receptor’s signals are properly received: mice lacking cilia become obese not because they overate but because they have a significant reduction in activity

[Neuroscience] Women tend to generate more novel ideas during ovulation compared to non-fertile phases of their ovulatory cycle. On a broader level, the findings also indicate that “creativity may be associated with mating, helping women to attract potential mates
